1. Direction: Scalar quantities have no direction, while vector quantities have a direction. Scalars are quantities that can be described by a single number, such as temperature, mass, and time. Vectors, on the other hand, are quantities that have both magnitude and direction, such as displacement, velocity, and acceleration.
